title: TikTok Shop - Partner Campaign Terms and Conditions
content:
*This document contains the English version of the terms followed by the Irish Gaelic version of the terms. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the English version and the Irish Gaelic version, the English version shall prevail.*
 ** 
Last updated: 24th February, 2025
 
TikTok Technology Limited, a company registered in the Republic of Ireland with company number 635755 and having its registered office at The Sorting Office, Ropemaker Place, Dublin 2, Dublin, D02 HD23 (“**TikTok**”) wishes to engage you, a TAP, CAP or TSP, as defined below (“**Partner**”, “**You”,** or “**Your**”) to provide Your services to TikTok in accordance with these terms and conditions (this “**Agreement**”). TikTok and Partner are collectively referred to herein as the “**Parties**” or individually as a “**Party**.”
If you enter into, or otherwise participate in, any TikTok Shop incentive program (each a “**Campaign**” and together the “**Campaigns**”) then you will be subject to this Agreement and be bound by its terms. This Agreement is subject to, and applies in addition to, the [TikTok Terms of Service](https://www.tiktok.com/legal/page/eea/terms-of-service/en), as updated or amended from time to time, and any other TikTok terms and policies that may be notified to You by TikTok from time to time. 
Any promotional materials relating to a Campaign provided to You by TikTok (“**Program Materials**”), including all information on the rules of entry for any Campaign, also form part of this Agreement. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the Program Materials, the online survey form distributed to You before a Campaign (the "**Term Sheet**") and this Agreement, the following order of precedence shall apply: (i) this Agreement; (ii) the Program Materials; and (iii) the Term Sheet.
For the avoidance of doubt and notwithstanding any other terms, including as set out in any Program Materials, You can only ever participate and benefit from Fees, as defined below, for one TikTok Campaign at any time, unless agreed otherwise in writing.
For information about how TikTok processes personal data, please see the [TikTok Privacy Policy](https://www.tiktok.com/legal/page/eea/privacy-policy/en).
# **1 DEFINITIONS & INTERPRETATION**

1.1 The meanings of any capitalised terms used in this Agreement are set out in the Term Sheet, the Program Materials or are otherwise defined below: 
| “**Affiliate**” | means in relation to any company, any other person or entity that directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with such company. |
| --- | --- |
| **“Agreement”** | means this agreement, including the Term Sheet, Program Materials and its schedules.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **“Business Day”** | means a day (other than a Saturday, Sunday or public holiday in the Republic of Ireland) when banks in Dublin are open for business. |
| **“CAP”** | means Creator Agency Partner and refers to service providers that focus on the acquisition and management of Creators for Campaigns.  |
| “**Confidential Information**” | means any and all information in any medium (including in hard copy, electronic or oral form) which relates to the business, technology, affairs, products and/or activities (including but not limited to advertising campaigns, challenges, partnerships and events) of TikTok, TikTok Shop and/or the TikTok Group, which is either (i) identified as confidential or (ii) should reasonably be recognised as confidential due to the nature, type or presentation of the information; and includes, but is in no way limited to, the terms of this Agreement, discussions about the Campaign, the status of the Campaign, and the Campaign itself. |
| "**Creator**" | means a social media content creator who has entered into the TikTok Shop Creator Terms of Use. |
| "**Effective Sales GMV**" | means 'effective sales gross merchandise volume' as calculated, notified and approved by TikTok to the Partner in writing. The Effective Sales GMV will be the amount of cleared payments for product sales made by TikTok users during the Campaign, less the amount of any products that: (a) are refunded within 30 days of receipt by the TikTok user; or (b) do not comply with any applicable laws or regulations, and/or TikTok’s terms and policies.  |
| **"Eligible Livestream"** | means a closed loop e-commerce livestream created or produced by a Creator which is shared on the Platform during the Campaign and which meets the requirements of this Agreement. |
| **"Eligible Short Video"** | means a closed loop e-commerce short video created or produced by a Creator which is shared on the Platform during the Campaign and which meets the requirements of this Agreement. |
| **“Fees”**  | means, as applicable, any fees, incentives, or other rewards that the Partner may be eligible to receive from TikTok for satisfying the Partner Requirements, as approved by TikTok in writing in advance and as further described in the Program Materials. |
| **“Partner Requirements”** | means the goals, targets, metrics, and any other criteria that the Partner must complete and achieve in order to receive any Fees, as notified to the Partner by TikTok from time to time and as further described in the Program Materials. |
| “**Partner Restrictions**” | means any limitations, exclusions or other restrictions that apply to the Partner’s eligibility to receive the Fees, as notified to the Partner by TikTok from time to time and as further described in the Program Materials. |
| “**Platform**” | means the TikTok owned and operated platform. |
| "**Popular 3C Products**" | means products identified by TikTok to the Partner including Apple products (iPhone, iPad, Macbook, Airpods, Apple watch, etc) and gaming consoles (e.g. PlayStation, Nintendo Switch, Xbox. etc) and gold bars. |
| "**Seller**" | means a seller who has entered into the EU: TikTok Shop Seller Terms of Service. |
| "**Services**" | means the services provided by the Partner under this Agreement, namely facilitating the creation and production of Eligible Livestreams and Eligible Short Videos and connecting Creators with Sellers, as further described in clause 2 below.  |
| “**TAP**”  | means TikTok Affiliate Partner and refers to service providers that engages Creators on the Seller’s behalf. |
| "**TikTok Guidelines**" | means TikTok's policies and guidelines from time to time, including the community guidelines set out [here](https://www.tiktok.com/community-guidelines/en?lang=en), advertising guidelines and the TikTok Shop livestream content creation guidelines set out in Schedule 1, in all cases as updated from time to time by TikTok. |
| “**TSP**” or “**TikTok Shop Partner**”  | refers to any third-party engaged to support and facilitate Seller’s use of TikTok Shop. |

1.2 In this Agreement the words "includes" or "including" shall be construed as illustrative only and shall not limit the generality of the preceding words.

# **2 SERVICES**

2.1 The Partner shall provide the Services during the Campaign.

   CAP Operational requirements

2.2 As part of the Services, the CAP shall:
2.2.1 ensure that each Eligible Livestream has at least one full-time staff member to assist the Creator throughout the Eligible Livestream;
2.2.2 be responsible for (i) all product sample purchases for Creators, including managing the shipping and handling receipt of such product samples, and any issues with such product samples; (ii) leasing of any studio premises; and (iii) travel arrangements for Creators to get to and from the studios; and
2.2.3 be responsible for entering into agreements with the Creators and any operational work connected to this Agreement which is notified to it by TikTok from time to time including:

   **(a) Before Eligible Livestreaming: **Creator training, equipment, studio (optional), travel fees (to (and from) studios), pre-Eligible Short Videos, product-matching and adding, product sample receiving, Eligible Livestream rehearsal;
   **(b) During Eligible Livestreaming:** product status management, livestream data performance monitoring, Creator prompting, and any other applicable operational work notified to the Partner by TikTok; and
   **(c) After Eligible Livestreaming: **recap-Eligible Short Videos, share performance recap and data.
   Creator and Seller requirements

2.3 The Partner shall:

   2.3.1 notify the names of the Creator accounts that the Partner will be supporting pursuant to this Agreement to TikTok in writing prior to the start of the Campaign for TikTok’s prior written approval (which it may withhold at its sole discretion);
   2.3.2 ensure that all Creators are based in the European Union with European Union based TikTok accounts;
   2.3.3 ensure that it meets and satisfies all of the Partner Requirements; 
   2.3.4 ensure that all Creator accounts feature as their main focus (i.e., a minimum of 90% of posts on the account) at least one human person (with a maximum of two). Accounts not featuring human personalities will not be eligible; and 
   2.3.5 ensure that all Creator and Seller accounts are genuine and not fake accounts, and are not involved in fake or fraudulent orders or transactions.
   Eligible Livestreams

2.4 The Partner shall ensure that each Eligible Livestream shall: 

   2.4.1 introduce, explain and pro-actively showcase at least 10 closed-loop products (and not only display them); and
   2.4.2 contain the shopping cart feature which must be made available to users.
   Eligible Livestreams and Eligible Short Videos

2.5 The Partner shall ensure that each Eligible Livestream and Eligible Short Video:

   2.5.1 complies with the terms of this Agreement;
   2.5.2 complies with the TikTok Guidelines (and the Partner shall notify any relevant third parties, Sellers and Creators of such guidelines);
   2.5.3 passes TikTok’s internal audits and meets any additional requirements and/or instructions provided by TikTok to the Partner from time to time;
   2.5.4 is solely focused on showcasing the products for sale, and informs users how to place orders for the products, including providing a link for users to click on to place orders;
   2.5.5 is a ‘closed loop’ (containing anchor link) e-commerce livestream or short video (as applicable) for TikTok Shop, such that the e-commerce experience shall take place on the Platform from end to end and the livestream or short video does not direct users off the Platform to other websites or platforms for execution of the sale or include links and/or guidance that takes users off the Platform;
   2.5.6 does not include live broadcast hanging or a black screen and does not fail to explain the products for sale, facilitate any fraud or fraudulent transactions or have a high return and refund rate (as determined by TikTok at its sole discretion); 
   2.5.7 showcases product(s) which have been uploaded to TikTok Shop in advance and are available for purchase by users at the time the Eligible Livestream commences or Eligible Short Video is posted (as applicable); and
   2.5.8 has bright lighting, a clean background and clear picture quality.
   Studio

2.6 The Partner shall ensure that any studios used under this Agreement meet the following requirements:

   2.6.1 the studios and their use must comply with all applicable health and safety, and any other applicable laws; 
   2.6.2 the Partner must have a valid legal right to occupy the studios for the Campaign; 
   2.6.3 the Partner must have obtained reasonable levels of insurance coverage for its operations and crew at the studios;
   2.6.4 the studios must be equipped with the production and production related equipment agreed between the Parties; and
   2.6.5 the studios must have access to appropriate internal infrastructure such as restrooms and coffee break areas, have good access to required utilities such as electricity, internet, and water, and reasonably required services such as cleaning/sanitation.

2.7 The Partner acknowledges that TikTok shall only be obliged to pay Fees to the Partner in relation to Creators approved by TikTok in writing, in advance and bound to the Partner on the backend of TikTok Shop. 
2.8 The determination of whether a short video is an Eligible Short Video and a livestream is an Eligible Livestream shall be made at the sole discretion of TikTok (acting reasonably) and its decision will be final.
2.9 If the Partner purchases product samples for the purposes of providing its Services to TikTok, the contract for sale and purchase of such samples will be between the Seller of that product sample and the Partner. TikTok shall have no responsibility for any product samples (including with respect to any returns, requests for refunds or any requests for a product sample to be repaired or replaced). To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, TikTok shall not be responsible or liable for (a) any loss, damage or theft to any product samples and/or (b) any wrong orders, delayed orders or faulty, defective or misdescribed product samples that the Partner may order or otherwise receive. TikTok makes no warranties or representations, express or implied, with respect to any product samples. The Partner will own and be solely responsible for any product samples.
# **3 INVOICING AND PAYMENT**

3.1 The Partner acknowledges and agrees that its receipt of any Fees hereunder is subject to the Partner Restrictions and is conditional on the Partner:

   3.1.1 successfully completing and achieving all the Partner Requirements during the Campaign; and
   3.1.2 complying with this Agreement and any other applicable TikTok policies or guidelines, as may be updated from time to time.

3.2 The Fees shall be paid in accordance with the Program Materials. Unless expressly agreed otherwise in writing by TikTok, any undisputed Fees due to the Partner by TikTok shall be paid within 30 days of Partner’s satisfactory completion of all applicable Services and after TikTok’s receipt of a valid undisputed invoice (as well as all the necessary and valid payment information of Partner requested by TikTok). TikTok will not under any circumstances be obliged to pay the Fees to the Partner prior to such time.
3.3 All expenses (including, if applicable, travel expenses) must be pre-approved by TikTok in writing in advance. If approved by TikTok, the Partner shall submit an expense request to TikTok including an itemized description of the expenses and deliver to TikTok any and all receipts relating to such expenses which correspond to the itemized description. If the Partner fails to comply with this clause 3.3, then no expenses shall be payable by TikTok.
3.4 If TikTok notifies the Partner of a bona fide dispute concerning the Fees, then TikTok shall pay any undisputed amount but shall be entitled to withhold the amount in dispute pending resolution. Payment in relation to which there is a bona fide dispute shall be made within 30 days of settlement of the dispute. 
3.5 To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, TikTok may at any time offset any liability of the Partner under this Agreement against any liability or monies owed by the Partner to TikTok. 
3.6 Save for the Fees (or any expenses pre-approved in writing by TikTok), TikTok shall not be responsible for any other costs or expenses incurred by the Partner in connection with this Agreement. Payment by TikTok (or its payment agent) to the bank account nominated by the Partner shall constitute full discharge of TikTok’s responsibility to pay any Fees (or expenses pre-approved in writing by TikTok) to the Partner. TikTok shall not be liable for any agent’s fees or commissions, taxes, production company fees or other payments to third parties payable by Partner in connection with this Agreement or the Services.
3.7 Each party shall be solely responsible for its own taxes and fees applicable to each party’s performance.
3.8 TikTok may from time-to-time review and audit all Eligible Livestreams, Eligible Short Videos, and orders placed from those videos and livestreams, and TikTok will have absolute discretion in determining the authenticity of such orders, and whether they qualify the Partner for Fees pursuant to this Agreement. Where TikTok deems that any Fee amounts have been calculated in breach of this Agreement (including as a result of fake or fraudulent orders or transactions), TikTok reserves the right not to pay such Fee amounts. 
# **4 TERM AND TERMINATION**

4.1 This Agreement shall continue until terminated in accordance with its terms.
4.2  Either Party may terminate this Agreement on 30 days’ written notice at any time and for any reason
4.3 Without prejudice to any rights or remedies available to TikTok under this Agreement or otherwise, TikTok may terminate this Agreement with immediate effect if:

   4.3.1 the Partner or any third party it engages (including any Creators and/or Sellers): 
      (a) breaches a provision of this Agreement and such breach is irremediable, or if such breach is capable of remedy (as solely determined by TikTok) fails to cure such breach within three (3) Business Days of being requested to do so by TikTok (and for the purposes of this clause, any breach of clause 5.1 shall be deemed to be a breach not capable of remedy); 
      (b) has at any time committed a crime (where TikTok is permitted to so terminate under applicable law); or 
      (c) has been involved in any situation or activity which in TikTok's sole opinion may: (i) have a negative effect or reflect unfavourably on the reputation of TikTok or its Affiliates or any aspect of their businesses; or (ii) expose TikTok or its Affiliates or any aspect of their businesses to disrepute, scandal, ridicule or contempt, or would tend to shock, insult or offend the public (such as posting or publishing on social media or elsewhere of any content that promotes bigotry, racism or discrimination based on race, gender, religion, nationality, disability, sexual orientation or age, or the use of, trade in, or other association with, illegal drugs);
   4.3.2 any Fees have been calculated in breach of this Agreement (including as a result of fake or fraudulent orders or transactions) (pursuant to clause 4.3.3);
   4.3.3 accounts connected with the Partner or any third party it engages are found to have received fake orders, fraudulent transactions, or a higher than average rate of returned goods (as determined by TikTok at its sole discretion); or 
   4.3.4 the Partner receives a material number of complaints or negative feedback from Sellers, Creators or any other third parties during a Campaign (as determined by TikTok at its sole discretion).

4.4 Where this Agreement is terminated under (i) clause 4.2, TikTok shall only be obliged to pay Fees for Eligible Livestreams and Eligible Short Videos which were posted prior to the effective date of termination, subject to the terms of this Agreement, or under (ii) clause 4.3, no Fees shall be payable to the Partner and TikTok shall be entitled to require the prompt repayment of any Fees received by the Partner to TikTok prior to the effective date of termination (regardless of whether the conditions for such Fees have been met).
4.5 On termination or expiry of this Agreement:

   4.5.1 any rights, remedies, obligations or liabilities of the Parties that have accrued up to the date of termination, including the right to claim damages in respect of any breach of the agreement which existed at or before the date of termination shall not be affected or prejudiced; and
   4.5.2 the rights and obligations of a Party, which by their nature, extend beyond the expiration or termination of this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect notwithstanding the expiration or termination of this Agreement (including clauses 1, 4, 5,6 and 7 of this Agreement). 

# **5 WARRANTIES AND INDEMNITY**
  ****  
5.1 The Partner warrants, represents and undertakes that: (a) it has the full, right, power, capacity and authority to enter into this Agreement, and to receive the Fees, and it is validly incorporated and duly registered under applicable laws and has the power to conduct its business; (b) its performance (including the receipt of the Fees) under this Agreement will not conflict with any other obligation the Partner may have to any third party; (c) the Partner will comply with all applicable laws, legal duties and contractual and other legal obligations, including all applicable codes of conduct and guidance which includes ensuring that the content created by each Creator is disclosed as advertising and marketing and, without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, the Partner will comply with TikTok’s Guidelines; (d) the Partner shall not at any time do or say anything which is or may be considered by TikTok to be detrimental or prejudicial to or to affect adversely the name, image, reputation or business of TikTok or any Seller or bring TikTok or any Seller into disrepute; (e) it will perform its Services in accordance with this Agreement and with all reasonable diligence, skill and care to be expected of a reputable provider of similar services; (f) the provision of the Services and any content created in connection with the Services will not infringe or violate the intellectual property or other rights of third parties, and will not contain any defamatory matter or content that may breach obligations of confidentiality or privacy; (g) it will carry and maintain at all times during the term of this Agreement all insurance required by applicable laws and otherwise as sufficient to secure the Partner’s obligations and potential liabilities under the Agreement in accordance with good industry practice; (h) to the extent the Partner makes use of third party owned materials in any content in connection with its Services, the Partner shall have obtained all necessary licences, permissions and consents to do so; (i) if Partner engages any Creator or presenter, he or she will be 18 years of age or older and Partner will request identification to confirm their age and, where permitted by applicable law, such Creator will not have any unspent criminal convictions of any kind subsisting at the commencement of and during the Campaign or after; (j) it shall procure that any third parties engaged by the Partner pursuant to this Agreement (including, without limitation, any Creators and Sellers) shall comply with the terms of this Agreement; and (k) it shall provide the Services in co-operation with TikTok (and any applicable third parties) and in accordance with TikTok's reasonable instructions from time to time.
5.2 The Partner will defend, indemnify and hold harmless TikTok and its Affiliates and its employees, offices, contractors, subcontractors and advisers (“**Representatives**”), licensees, successors and assignees (“**Indemnified Parties**”) on demand from: (i) any and all claims, losses, damages, liabilities and expenses incurred or sustained as a result of the Partner’s actual or alleged breach of this Agreement (including any third party (including any regulatory authority) claims, demands, investigations, actions or proceedings brought or threatened against the Indemnified Parties in relation to such actual or alleged breach); and/or (ii) any third party claims, demands, actions or proceedings brought or threatened against the Indemnified Parties, where such third party claims to be entitled to Fees in connection with this Agreement.
# **6 CONFIDENTIALITY**

6.1 Each Party (“**receiving party**”) must keep all Confidential Information strictly confidential and shall not use the Confidential Information for any purpose other than to perform its obligations under this Agreement and must not do the following without the prior written consent of the other Party (“**disclosing party**”): (i) disclose any of the Confidential Information to any third party (other than those of its Representatives with a strict need to know the Confidential Information in order to perform the Agreement, and provided that (a) such Representatives are bound by non-use and disclosure requirements that are at least as restrictive as those set forth herein, and (b) the disclosing party shall be liable for the acts or omissions of each such Representative in relation to the Confidential Information as if they were the acts or omissions of the disclosing party); or (ii) make any press announcements or otherwise publicise the existence or provisions of this Agreement or the general nature of the relationship between the Parties. 
6.2 Confidential Information does not include information that: (i) is or becomes generally known to the public through no fault of or breach of this Agreement by the receiving party; (ii) is rightfully known by the receiving party at the time of disclosure without an obligation of confidentiality; (iii) is independently developed by the receiving party without use of the Confidential Information; or (iv) the receiving party rightfully obtains from a third party without restriction on use or disclosure. The foregoing obligations (and the obligations of confidentiality set out in this clause 6) will not restrict the receiving party from disclosing Confidential Information pursuant to a requirement of a court, administrative agency, or other governmental body, provided that the receiving party gives reasonable notice to the disclosing party to contest such requirement. The receiving party shall return the Confidential Information to the disclosing party upon the disclosing party’s written request and, upon expiry or termination of this Agreement for any reason, and at the disclosing party’s option, delete or return all Confidential Information to the disclosing party.
# **7 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY**

7.1 Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to exclude or limit any liability of either Party which cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law (including death or personal injury caused by negligence or fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation).
7.2 Subject always to clause 7.1 and except in relation to its payment obligations under this Agreement, TikTok excludes, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any and all liability arising under or in connection with this Agreement, including but not limited to liability in contract, tort (including negligence), misrepresentation, restitution or otherwise. 
7.3 In no event shall TikTok be liable for punitive, indirect or consequential losses or the Partner’s loss of actual or anticipated profits (whether direct or indirect). 
7.4 To the extent clause 7.2 is ineffective to exclude TikTok's liability (or any part of it) for any reason, and subject always to clauses 7.1 and 7.3, TikTok’s total liability under and in connection with this Agreement, except in relation to its payment obligations under this Agreement, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), misrepresentation, restitution or otherwise, shall be limited to EUR5,000.
7.5 Subject to clause 5.1, all warranties, representations, conditions and all other terms of any kind whatsoever implied by statute or common law are, to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, excluded from this Agreement.
# **8 GENERAL**

8.1 The following provisions shall apply to this Agreement: (a) this Agreement and any dispute or claim (whether contractual or non-contractual) arising in connection with it, its subject matter or formation will be governed by the laws of England and Wales and the courts of England and Wales shall have exclusive jurisdiction; (b) this Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and supersedes and replaces any other statements on the same subject matter, and each Party acknowledges that in entering into this Agreement it does not rely on, and shall have no remedies in respect of, any statement, representation, assurance or warranty (whether made innocently or negligently) that is not set out in this Agreement and the only remedy available in respect of any misrepresentation or untrue statement made to it shall be a claim for breach of contract under this Agreement; (c) any modifications to this Agreement must be made in writing and executed by duly authorised representatives of both Parties; (d) any notices served under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be sent by email to the email addresses specified by the Parties from time to time (which for TikTok is e-commerce@tiktok.com and for the Partner is set out in the Term Sheet) and shall be deemed received upon successful transmission; (e) a waiver by a Party of default is not a waiver by that Party of any other default; (f) unenforceable provisions will be modified to reflect the intention of the Parties and only to the extent necessary to make them enforceable, and remaining provisions of this Agreement will remain in full force and effect; (g) neither Party will sub-contract or assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder without prior written notice to the other Party, except that TikTok may assign its rights and obligations, including as part of a merger, acquisition or internal reorganisation without the consent of the Partner; (h) this Agreement does not create a partnership and the Parties are and shall remain independent contractors; (i) a person who is not a Party to this Agreement shall not have any rights to enforce any term of this Agreement, except that TikTok and its Affiliates may benefit from and enforce any term of this Agreement. The rights of the Parties to terminate, rescind or agree any variation, waiver or settlement under this Agreement are not subject to the consent of any other person; and (j) nothing in this Agreement will be deemed or construed to prohibit TikTok from providing an incentive program to any third parties.  Each Party shall be responsible for its own costs in connection with this Agreement.
8.2 The Partner shall comply with all data protection laws. The Parties acknowledge and agree that to the extent any customer data or personal data will be shared between the Parties, the Parties will enter into an appropriate separate data sharing agreement at that time on such terms as TikTok may require.

<div style="text-align: center"><h1 id="b55f6b93"><strong>SCHEDULE 1</strong></h1></div>

<div style="text-align: center"></div>

<div style="text-align: center"><strong>TikTok Shop Livestream Content Creation Guidelines</strong></div>

These guidelines summarise the key rules to follow when creating content for TikTok Shop. Please read and make sure you understand these guidelines before doing so. 
If you are a Partner, Seller, Creator or any other party involved in content creation, you should note that these guidelines are not an exhaustive list of your obligations and do not override those obligations imposed on you by law or under the terms and conditions that apply to your use of TikTok Shop. You are fully responsible for ensuring that your content complies with applicable laws and regulations, and the [TikTok Community Guidelines](https://www.tiktok.com/community-guidelines/en?lang=en). Please note, these guidelines do not constitute legal advice, and you must consult a lawyer if you have any questions about the rules relating to content creation for the TikTok Shop.
Commercial content should always be labelled appropriately with a clear primary advertisement label (i.e. #ad; platform provided label (e.g. ‘paid partnership’; or #gifted)) and use of a secondary label as appropriate (e.g. #collaboration; #BrandAmbassador; #Sponsored) or that may be required by applicable law or any applicable governing body or regulator (and you shall ensure that you use the Content Disclosure Settings provided by TikTok and comply with the [TikTok Shop EU Content Guidelines for Sellers and Creators](https://seller-ie.tiktok.com/university/essay?knowledge_id=8154736403449633&identity=1)). Labels should be clearly positioned using appropriate colour that stands out from the background – (i) for posts, the label should be the first word of the text; and (ii) for videos, clear visual advertising label at the start of the video and tell the audience.

## **1. Take care not to mislead your audience** 

When promoting something to your audience, it is important that you provide them with all the information they need to make an informed decision before purchase, that you do not provide any false or misleading information, and that you do not mislead by omitting information or presenting information in an unclear or ambiguous manner. 

***Price and availability***
 
**✅ Do** make sure that when stating the price of a product you make clear the whole price of purchasing that product (including any delivery charges and taxes), not just the price of the item itself.
**✅ Do** make sure that you make it clear to your audience that stock is limited (where applicable), to avoid disappointment. 
**✅ Do** make clear any restrictions on the availability of the products, including any geographical restrictions or age limits.
 
**❎ Don’t** advertise one product and switch it for a different type of product when sending it to the customer. You must advertise the same type of product to your audience, so they know what they are purchasing. 
**❎ Don’t** falsely state that a product will only be available for a very limited time or that stock is limited where this is not the case in order to pressure the customer into making an immediate decision. 

***Claims and factual statements***
 ****** 
**✅ Do** make sure you have evidence to prove any claims that your audience are likely to regard as factually true.
**✅ Do** take care when making any environmental claims about the advertised product. If you want to make an environmental-related claim about the product, you must ensure that the basis of the claim is clear, and what part of the advertised product it relates to and include all appropriate qualifications. The meaning of all terms must be clear to your audience (such as “recycled”, “green” or “sustainable”).
**✅ Do** make sure any environmental claims about the advertised products are supported by evidence, and make sure you keep a record of this (unqualified environmental claims should not be made unless they can be substantiated by showing that the product will cause no environmental damage). Please speak to a lawyer if you are not sure how to properly back up your claim. 
 
**❎ Don’t** compare one product with another (by price, attribute or otherwise). 
**❎ Don’t** claim that you are acting as a consumer, as opposed to in the course of your business or trade.
**❎ Don’t** present rights that the consumer has under the law as a special right / benefit that you have granted them (e.g. a right to a return after 14 days).
**❎ Don’t** over-exaggerate. Naturally, you want to portray the advertised product in the best light, but you must make sure that your audience is not led to believe the capability or performance of the product is better than it actually is. You must be able to substantiate with documentary evidence, all claims which a consumer may believe to be objectively true.
**❎ Don’t** display a trust or quality mark without first gaining appropriate permission.
**❎ Don’t** include or imply third party endorsements or testimonials in your content, unless you have evidence of the endorsement, and permission from the third party to share it. 
**❎ Don’t** claim that the product can cure illnesses or has any health benefits where this is not the case. 
**❎ Don't** promote any medicinal products and medical treatments that are available only on prescription.
**❎ Don’t** use the phrase “guarantee”. This is a legally sensitive term and could confuse your audience about their rights in connection with the advertised product.
**❎ Don't** use or display any products for any purpose for which the product has not been designed. 
 **** 
## **2. Don’t cause harm or offence**

Don’t include anything in the content that you create that is likely to cause serious or widespread offence or that could be deemed to damage the reputation of anyone.
 
**❎ Don’t** include any content that is discriminatory or promotes discrimination in any way (including on the basis of sex, racial or ethnic origin, nationality, religion or belief, disability, age or sexual orientation, marital status, family status or Membership of the Traveller Community) or is likely to harass, defame or threaten another person. 
**❎ Don't** include any content that is unlawful or fraudulent or has any unlawful or fraudulent purpose or effect. 
**❎ Don't** include any content that includes alcohol, smoking or gambling or any other age restricted products or activities.
**❎ Don't** include any content that infringes a third party's rights, including rights to intellectual property, image rights, confidentiality or privacy, or is likely to deceive any person.
**❎ Don't** promote any sexually explicit material or violence or encourage any person to do a harmful or criminal act. 
**❎ Don't** impersonate another person or misrepresent your identity or affiliation with any person. 
**❎ Don’t** swear. 
**❎ Don’t** encourage behaviour that is violent, socially irresponsible or prejudicial to health and safety or the protection of the environment.
**❎ Don’t** include any content that could damage the reputation of any company, brand or individual. 
**❎ Don’t** portray or represent anyone who is, or seems to be, under 18 in a sexual way or show them in any type of dangerous situation. 
**❎ Don't** show **** any unsafe use of products or use products in a dangerous way.  **** 

## **3. Tailor to your audience** 
 
When creating content, be aware of who the audience is, and whether there are any sensitivities to keep in mind. Think about the context in which your content is made, the product you are promoting, the age and background of your audience, and relevant standards and attitudes. Remember that certain members of your audience may be more vulnerable than others, and therefore more impacted by your marketing content.
 
**❎ Don’t** include visual effects or techniques that are likely to adversely affect members of the public with photosensitive epilepsy.
**❎ Don’t** directly target under 18s to encourage them to buy the advertised product.
**❎ Don’t** try and encourage under 18s to persuade their parents or guardians to buy anything on their behalf.

## **4. Only offer genuine discounts**
 **** 
You should take particular care when comparing a discounted price of a product to another price (a “reference price”) for the same product. 
 
**✅ Do** ensure that reference prices are genuine and verifiable. 
**✅ Do** make sure that the reference price is the lowest price the product was offered via the TikTok Shop by the specific trader the previous 30 days, and is included in all promotional statements about a price reduction of that specific product. 
 
**❎ Don’t** use reference prices that are older than the lowest price the product was advertised at on the TikTok Shop in the previous 30 days before the discount was applied. 
**❎ Don’t** artificially increase prices for a short period of time to facilitate the advertising of a discount. If you increase a price, you can’t use that increased price as the reference price for any discounting until the product has been sold at that increased price for at least 30 days. 
**❎ Don’t** offer a discounted price that is not lower than the reference price. 

## **5. Organising promotions carefully**
 
If you are organising a promotion to advertise a product, such as by offering a discount or running a competition or prize draw, it is important that you administer the promotion carefully.  
 
**✅ Do** conduct your promotion equitably, fairly, and efficiently. For competitions / draws, make sure you keep a record of how the promotion will be administered, and how the winner will be selected. 
**✅ Do** make sure you estimate the likely response from your audience, and keep a record of this, to ensure that you can meet availability and your audience are aware of the opportunity to win.
**✅ Do** make all the important information available, setting out how to participate, the start date and closing date, any free-to-enter routes available, the number and nature of prizes, any restrictions (geographical, technical, or otherwise), availability of prizes, and how and when winners will be notified of results. This includes any geographical, age, eligibility restrictions, any requirements on proof of purchase, any permissions required (e.g. parental), any limit on the number of prizes, whether a cash alternative can be substituted for the prize.
**✅ Do** make sure your promotion is conducted under proper supervision with adequate resources in place to administer it. 
**✅ Do** ensure that any competition or prize draw complies with all applicable gambling and related regulatory requirements and seek specific legal advice where necessary.  ****  
**✅ Do,** if the selection of the winner is subject to subjective interpretation, appoint an independent judge, or a panel to judge the subject matter of the competition (or an independent observer in the case of prize draws).
 
**❎ Don’t** claim that any product is ‘free’, ‘without charge’ or similar if the consumer has to pay anything other than a delivery charge.

## **6. Music and third-party rights** 
 
You must ensure that you only include music and other third-party creative content which you have the rights to.
 
**✅ Do** include music from the Commercial Music Library, if you wish to include music in your content.
 
**❎ Don’t** include music which is not available in the Commercial Music Library unless you have obtained the necessary music licensing rights to use it and provided TikTok with evidence of this. 
**❎ Don’t** refer to third party names or include third party logos in your content unless you have the permission of the third party to do so.

# **2 SEIRBHÍSÍ**

2.1 Soláthróidh an Comhpháirtí na Seirbhísí le linn an Fheachtais.

   Ceanglais oibríochtúla CAP

2.2 Mar chuid de na Seirbhísí, déanfaidh an CAP an méid seo a leanas:

   2.2.1 a chinntiú go bhfuil ar a laghad ball foirne lánaimseartha amháin ag gach Beoshruth Incháilithe chun cabhrú leis an gCruthaitheoir le linn an Beosrutha Incháilithe;
   2.2.2 a bheith freagrach as (i) gach sampla táirge a cheannaítear do Chruthaitheoirí, lena n-áirítear bainistiú a dhéanamh ar sheoladh agus láimhseáil samplaí táirgí den sórt sin, agus aon saincheisteanna a bhaineann le samplaí táirgí den sórt sin; (ii) léasú aon áitribh stiúideo; agus (iii) socruithe taistil do Chruthaitheoirí chun dul chuig na stiúideonna agus uathu; agus
   2.2.3 a bheith freagrach as comhaontuithe a dhéanamh leis na Cruthaitheoirí agus as aon obair oibríochta a bhaineann leis an gComhaontú seo a chuireann TikTok in iúl dó ó am go ham lena n-áirítear:
      (a) Roimh Sruthú Beo Incháilithe: Roimh Sruthú Beo Incháilithe: Oiliúint cruthaitheoirí, trealamh, stiúideo (roghnach), táillí taistil (chuig (agus ó) stiúideonna), Físeáin Ghearr-Incháilithe réamh-Incháilithe, meaitseáil agus cur leis an táirge, fáil samplaí táirge, cleachtadh Beoshrutha Incháilithe;
      (b) Le linn Sruthú Beo Incháilithe: bainistíocht stádais táirge, monatóireacht ar fheidhmíocht sonraí srutha beo, leideanna ón gCruthaitheoir, agus aon obair oibríochta is infheidhme eile a chuir TikTok in iúl don Chomhpháirtí; agus
      (c) Tar éis Sruthú Beo Incháilithe: Físeáin Ghearr atá Incháilithe le haghaidh achoimre, roinnt achoimre feidhmíochta agus sonraí.
      Riachtanais an Chruthaitheora agus an Díoltóra

2.3 Déanfaidh an Comhpháirtí an méid seo a leanas:

   2.3.1 ainmneacha na gcuntas Cruthaitheora a mbeidh an Comhpháirtí ag tacú leo de bhun an Chomhaontaithe seo a chur in iúl do TikTok i scríbhinn roimh thús an Fheachtais le haghaidh ceadú roimh ré i scríbhinn ó TikTok (a d'fhéadfadh sé a choinneáil siar dá rogha féin amháin);
   2.3.2 a chinntiú go bhfuil gach Cruthaitheoir bunaithe san Aontas Eorpach le cuntais TikTok atá bunaithe san Aontas Eorpach;
   2.3.3 a chinntiú go gcomhlíonann sé agus go sásaíonn sé na Riachtanais Chomhpháirtithe go léir; 
   2.3.4 a chinntiú go bhfuil gach cuntas Cruthaitheoir mar phríomhfhócas (.i., 90% ar a laghad de phoist ar an gcuntas) duine daonna amháin ar a laghad (le dhá cheann ar a mhéad). Ní bheidh cuntais nach bhfuil pearsantachtaí daonna iontu incháilithe; agus 
   2.3.5 a chinntiú gur cuntais fíor agus nach cuntais bhréige iad gach cuntas Cruthaitheora agus Díoltóra, agus nach bhfuil baint acu le horduithe nó le hidirbhearta bréige nó calaoiseacha.
   Sruthanna Beo Incháilithe

2.4 Áiritheoidh an Comhpháirtí go ndéanfaidh gach Beo-sruth Incháilithe an méid seo a leanas: 

   2.4.1 10 dtáirge le lúb dúnta acu ar a laghad a thabhairt isteach, a mhíniú agus a thaispeáint go réamhghníomhach (agus ní hamháin iad a thaispeáint); agus
   2.4.2 gné an tralaí siopadóireachta a bheith ann nach mór a chur ar fáil d’úsáideoirí.
   Sruthanna Beo Incháilithe agus Físeáin Ghearr Incháilithe

2.5 Áiritheoidh an Comhpháirtí go ndéanfaidh na Sruthanna Beo Incháilithe agus na Físeáin Ghearr Incháilithe ar fad an méid seo a leanas:

   2.5.1 téarmaí an Chomhaontaithe seo a chomhlíonadh;
   2.5.2 Treoirlínte TikTok (agus tabharfaidh an Comhpháirtí fógra d’aon tríú páirtithe, Díoltóirí agus Cruthaitheoirí ábhartha maidir le treoirlínte den sórt sin) a chomhlíonadh;
   2.5.3 pas a fháil in iniúchtaí inmheánacha TikTok agus go gcomhlíonann sé aon cheanglais agus/nó treoracha breise a sholáthraíonn TikTok don Chomhpháirtí ó am go chéile;
   2.5.4 go bhfuil sé dírithe go hiomlán ar na táirgí atá ar díol a thaispeáint, agus cuireann sé in iúl d’úsáideoirí conas orduithe a dhéanamh do na táirgí, lena n-áirítear nasc a sholáthar d’úsáideoirí chun cliceáil air chun orduithe a chur;
   2.5.5 gur ‘lúb dúnta’ é (ina bhfuil nasc ancaire) sruth beo ríomhthráchtála nó físeán gearr (de réir mar is infheidhme) le haghaidh TikTok Shop, sa chaoi is go dtarlóidh an taithí ríomhthráchtála ar an Ardán ó cheann go ceann agus go ndéanann an sruth beo nó an físeán gearr gan úsáideoirí a dhíriú den Ardán chuig suíomhanna gréasáin nó ardáin eile chun an díolachán a chur i gcrích nó ní áiríonn siad naisc agus/nó treoir a bhainfidh úsáideoirí den Ardán;
   2.5.6 nach bhfolaíonn sé craoladh beo crochta nó scáileán dubh agus ní mhainníonn sé na táirgí atá ar díol a mhíniú, aon idirbhearta calaoise nó calaoiseach a éascú nó a bhfuil ráta ard toraidh agus aisíocaíochta aige (mar a chinneann TikTok dá rogha féin amháin); 
   2.5.7 go dtaispeántar táirge/táirgí a uaslódáiltear chuig TikTok Shop roimh ré ann agus atá ar fáil le ceannach ag úsáideoirí ag an am a thosaíonn an Sruthbeo Incháilithe nó an Físeán Gearr Incháilithe (de réir mar is infheidhme); agus
   2.5.8 go bhfuil soilsiú geal, cúlra glan agus cáilíocht pictiúr soiléir ann;
   Stiúideo

2.6 Cinnteoidh an Comhpháirtí go gcomhlíonann aon stiúideonna a úsáidtear faoin gComhaontú seo na ceanglais seo a leanas:

   2.6.1 ní mór do na stiúideonna agus a n-úsáid cloí le gach dlí sláinte agus sábháilteachta is infheidhme, agus aon dlí eile is infheidhme; 
   2.6.2 ní mór go mbeadh ceart dlíthiúil bailí ag an gComhpháirtí áitiú ar stiúideonna an Fheachtais; 
   2.6.3 caithfidh an Comhpháirtí leibhéil réasúnta árachais a bheith faighte aige dá oibríochtaí agus dá chriú ag na stiúideonna; 
   2.6.4 ní mór na stiúideonna a bheith feistithe leis an trealamh a bhaineann le táirgeadh agus táirgeadh arna chomhaontú idir na Páirtithe; agus
   2.6.5 ní mór go mbeadh rochtain ag na stiúideonna ar bhonneagar inmheánach cuí ar nós seomraí scíthe agus limistéir sos caife, rochtain mhaith a bheith acu ar fhóntais riachtanacha ar nós leictreachas, idirlín agus uisce, agus seirbhísí a bhfuil gá réasúnta leo ar nós glantacháin/sláintíochta.

2.7 Admhaíonn an Comhpháirtí nach mbeidh oibleagáid ar TikTok ach Táillí a íoc leis an gComhpháirtí maidir le Cruthaitheoirí arna gceadú ag TikTok i scríbhinn, roimh ré agus faoi cheangal ag an gComhpháirtí ar inneall TikTok Shop.
2.8 Is faoi lánrogha TikTok amháin (ag gníomhú go réasúnach) a dhéanfar an cinneadh an bhfuil físeán gearr ina Fhíseán Gearr Incháilithe agus an sruth beo é ina Shruth Beo Incháilithe agus is cinneadh críochnaitheach a bheidh sa chinneadh..
2.9 Má cheannaíonn an Comhpháirtí samplaí táirgí chun críocha a chuid Seirbhísí a sholáthar do TikTok, beidh an conradh chun samplaí den sórt sin a dhíol agus a cheannach idir Díoltóir an tsampla táirge sin agus an Comhpháirtí. Ní bheidh aon fhreagracht ar TikTok as aon samplaí táirge (lena n-áirítear maidir le haon tuairisceáin, iarratais ar aisíocaíochtaí nó aon iarratais ar shampla táirge a dheisiú nó a athsholáthar). A mhéid a cheadaítear leis an dlí is infheidhme, ní bheidh TikTok freagrach ná faoi dhliteanas (a) as aon chaillteanas, damáiste nó goid ar aon samplaí táirge agus/nó (b) aon orduithe míchearta, orduithe moillithe nó samplaí táirge lochtacha, lochtacha nó míthuairiscithe. a fhéadfaidh an Comhpháirtí a ordú nó a fháil ar shlí eile. Ní thugann TikTok aon bharántas nó uiríll, sainráite nó intuigthe, maidir le haon samplaí táirge. Is leis an gComhpháirtí agus beidh sé nó sí amháin freagrach as aon samplaí táirge.

6.2 Ní fholaíonn Faisnéis Rúnda faisnéis: (i) atá nó a thagann chun bheith eolach go ginearálta ag an bpobal gan aon locht nó sárú ar an gComhaontú seo ag an bpáirtí glactha; (ii) go bhfuil sé ar eolas go ceart ag an bpáirtí fála tráth an nochta gan oibleagáid rúndachta; (iii) atá forbartha go neamhspleách ag an bpáirtí glactha gan úsáid a bhaint as an bhFaisnéis Rúnda; nó (iv) go bhfaigheann an páirtí glactha go ceart ó thríú páirtí gan srian ar úsáid nó nochtadh. Ní chuirfidh na hoibleagáidí sin roimhe seo (agus na hoibleagáidí rúndachta atá leagtha amach i gclásal 6 seo) srian ar an bpáirtí fála ó Fhaisnéis Rúnda a nochtadh de bhun ceanglais ó chúirt, ó ghníomhaireacht riaracháin, nó ó chomhlacht rialtais eile, ar choinníoll go dtugann an páirtí glactha fógra réasúnach. don pháirtí a nochtfaidh an ceanglas sin a chonspóid.
